summary: Email correspondence from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an unidentified recipient, requesting follow-up information on how invoices related to Jeffrey Epstein and his associates were paid, specifically asking about payment methods like credit cards or bank accounts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email is part of a request for information relating to Jeffrey Epstein and his associates, specifically regarding invoice payments.

events.title: Follow-up on Epstein invoice payments
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney follows up on a conversation regarding invoice information for Jeffrey Epstein and his associates, asking specifically about payment methods.

keyFacts: The document is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York dated March 10, 2020.
The email is part of an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his associates, specifically requesting information on how invoices were paid.
The recipient previously indicated invoices were paid via American Express, based on their recollection.
The prosecutor is seeking details on payment methods such as credit cards or bank accounts.
The correspondence indicates ongoing financial investigation into Epstein's activities as of March 2020.
